The origin of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim about the Israeli combat robot and US Delta force robot used to kill ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi was shared on social media. This aspect verifies the source of the claim and where it was initially circulated.
Contextual information: The expert's verdict highlights that the video was also shared with an anti-Muslim narrative and that the claim was massively circulated on Facebook. This aspect provides context about how the claim was presented and the platform on which it gained traction.
Verification of video authenticity: The expert's verdict mentions that the video in question was shared on social media and also appeared on YouTube. This aspect suggests that efforts were made to verify the authenticity of the video by analyzing its source and checking for any previous instances of its sharing.
Message content analysis: The expert's verdict includes a message that accompanied the video, stating that it was received from WhatsApp and describing the robot as a real US Delta force "Robot" used in an operation to kill Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. This aspect involves analyzing the content of the message to assess its credibility and accuracy.
